summary: Frontend UI testing for role-based visibility on Project Payments page. All features implemented correctly - Admin sees full details, Consultant sees restricted view.

details: Total Received card visible (₹1,19,357.00)
Total Project Value card visible (₹6,09,858.00)
Active Projects card visible (3)
Upcoming Amount card visible (₹3,45,600.00)
My Projects and Upcoming Payments tabs both visible
Consultant names visible in project cards
First Advance Payment card visible with full details (Amount, Transaction ID, Payment Date, Verified By)
Total Project Value visible in header (₹5,00,000.00)
Payment Schedule table shows all amount columns (Basic, GST, TDS, Net)
All 5 payment installments visible with amounts
Inherited SOW tab NOT present (correctly removed)
Total Received card NOT visible
Total Project Value card NOT visible
Upcoming Amount card NOT visible
Active Projects card visible (2)
Upcoming Payments COUNT card visible (4) - not amount
Only My Projects tab visible - no Upcoming Payments tab
Project cards show First Payment status (Received) without amount
Subtitle shows 'View upcoming payment schedules for your projects'
First Advance Payment card NOT visible
Total Project Value NOT visible
Amount columns (Basic, GST, TDS, Net) NOT visible
Amounts hidden indicator displayed
Title shows 'UPCOMING PAYMENT DATES' instead of 'PAYMENT SCHEDULE'
First payment (received) NOT shown - schedule starts from Month 2
Only shows #, Frequency, Due Date, Status columns
Inherited SOW tab NOT present
Confirmed tab is NOT present for both Admin and Consultant views
Only Payment Schedule and Consultant Breakdown tabs available

context_for_next_testing_agent: Role-based visibility for Project Payments page is fully implemented and working correctly. Backend returns can_view_amounts and is_consultant_view flags. Frontend conditionally renders UI elements based on these flags. Admin/Principal Consultant sees full details. Consultant sees only upcoming payment dates without amounts. Reporting Manager view not tested due to lack of test credentials.
